intro: Rhomboda moulmeinensis, commonly known as the Moulmein rhombod, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rhomboid-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
